Description: Fragment of round handle at neck join from a Brindisi pottery transport amphora. Clay near fine buff; mixed inclusions; cream surface. Rectangular stamp at top of handle with Latin inscription.
Curator's comments: Name Allius. Drawn by Petrie (Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47) p. 91, 2). One, less complete, parallel, in Taranto, is known (D. Manacorda, pers.comm.)
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.1276)
